results.title: The Science of winning
results.brief_description: This film shows specialists at the Australian Institute of Sport in Canberra working elite athletes, applying the processes of physiology, biochemistry, biomechanics and psychology. This is a thought-provoking document about the development of our systematic scientific approach to sports training.

results.title: Breaking silence
results.brief_description: An epidemic number of children endure their early years in confusion and shame as victims of incest and other forms of sexual exploitation. This documentary goes behind the veneer of domestic bliss to study the incidence and effect of incest on families.

results.title: Private practices: the story of a sex surrogate
results.creator_credit: Kirby Dick and Kirby Dick Productions
results.brief_description: This film is about Maureen Sullivan, a woman who practises a radical new kind of sex therapy. She is a sex surrogate. Her clients are men unable to have successful sexual relationships. Her job is to help them learn how to love. What follows is the story of two clients who allowed their entire therapy to be filmed. Maureen saw each man once a week for four months. Supervised by a therapist, she guided the men through a series of sexual exercises that became progressively more intimate. Narrated by Noreen Hennessey.

results.title: Pitjiri: the snake that will not sink
results.creator_credit: Karen Hughes and Trikon Film Corporation
results.brief_description: In 1936 on a remote outpost in the Northern Territory, nine aboriginal elders appeared before Ruth Heathcock, a young white nurse who they believed was a member of their tribe before the Dreaming. What she later experienced in her healing work is the subject of this extraordinary documentary. A multi-award winning production.

results.brief_description: Women in mid-life share their thoughts and experiences of menopause. This film provides role models who demonstrate that there is life after menopause.

results.title: The Sharkcallers of Kontu
results.creator_credit: Dennis O'Rourke, Institute of Papua New Guinea Studies and O'Rourke and Associates Filmakers
results.brief_description: In a few villages on the west coast of Papua New Guinea a handful of men still practise the ancient ritual of sharkcalling. Colonisation and economic exploitation is slowly bringing to a close this spectacular and dangerous ritual. Dennis O’Rourke lived with the people to learn about sharkcalling and to understand the forces affecting their culture. Edited by Stewart Young. Photographed by Dennis O’Rourke and Chris Owen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis O’Rourke, Institute of Papua New Guinea Studies and O’Rourke and Associates Filmakers

results.title: Rocking the foundations
results.creator_credit: Pat Fiske, Australian Film Commission. Creative Development Branch and Bower Bird Films
results.brief_description: A film that goes behind the headlines to look at the extraordinary chain of events that has made the New South Wales Builders’ Labourers’ Federation the controversial part of Australian history that it is today. It is a story about workers who began to act for themselves and make decisions about issues that affected ordinary people. Also looks at the new policies that saw women introduced into the building industry, limited tenure of office and the use of union power to assist resident action and environmental groups. Narrated by Pat Fiske. (NOTE: 16mm print is black and white.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pat Fiske, Australian Film Commission. Creative Development Branch and Bower Bird Films

results.title: Las Madres de Plaza de Mayo
results.brief_description: A compelling documentary account of the protests organised by the mothers of 30,000 people who disappeared in Argentina during the wave of kidnapping, tortures and murders initiated by the military junta during the 1970s. Winner of 17 International Awards.

results.title: Half life
results.creator_credit: Dennis O'Rourke and O'Rourke and Associates Filmakers
results.brief_description: This feature-length masterpiece reveals the effects of US nuclear tests on the lives of the inhabitants of the Marshall Islands in the Pacific Ocean. The film combines recently declassified US Defence Department footage on the Bravo Test of 1954 with interviews with the people of Rongelap who were not evacuated. Contains black & white footage.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis O’Rourke and O’Rourke and Associates Filmakers
